metadata.title: Wednesday, 4th July, 2012
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)  when the Government will build the following facilities in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency:
(i)   a police station at Chivuna; and (ii)  police posts at Nkonkola, Musuma, Munenga, Mukuyu and Itebe; and
(b) when Magoye Police Station will be rehabilitated.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)   whether there was any company that prospected for diamonds in Shangombo District between 2001 and 2004; and
(b)   if so, what the results of the exercise were.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development how much money is required by ZESCO Limited to supply electricity country-wide to the following facilities
parts: (a)  new residential houses;
(b)  farm houses; and
(c)  commercial properties.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)  whether feasibility studies for the construction of a bridge on Kalungu river, to connect Chunga to Katukauchu in Nakonde District have been undertaken; and
(b)  if not, when the studies will be undertaken.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)  whether the Government has plans to recognise sub-chiefs in the country by granting them full chief status; and
(b)  if so, when the process will start.
(a)  whether the Government has any plans to upgrade the following clinics in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency to hospitals:
(i)   Magoye; (ii)   Mukuyu; and (iii)  Munenga;
(b)  if so, when the upgrading will begin; and
(c)  when the Government will construct clinics at Chimwaikila and Kasako fishing villages.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)  whether there are any plans to construct a boarding school in Mwembeshi Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)  whether there are any plans to convert the following community schools into Government schools:
(i)   Chibenge; (ii)   Mwanakachemba; (iii)  Kapela; (iv) Shikaluma; and
(v)  Shabishabi.
(a)   when the Government will construct a modern stadium in Kabwe; and
(b)  when the Government will rehabilitate the following stadia in Kabwe:
(i)    Winter Muleya; (ii)   President; and (iii)   Railway Grounds.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)  whether the Ministry is aware that some girls’ hostels, teachers’ houses and a laboratory block at Mumbwa High School have been declared unfit for human habitation; and
(b)  if so, what immediate plans the Ministry has to normalise the situation.

questions.minister: Minister of Foreign Affairs and Tourism
parts: (a)  how much money is paid as licence fees to the Zambia Wildlife Authority for fishing within the Mweru-Wantipa National Park in Kaputa District; and
(b)  whether the fees also apply to the local community.

questions.minister: Minister of Finance and National Planning whether there were any benefits that accrued to the economy as of 31st March, 2012, following the reduction in fuel prices and the sale of maize grain at discounted rates by the Food Reserve Agency and, if so, what the benefits are.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)  when Mulamatila Basic School in Kaoma Central Parliamentary Constituency, whose infrastructure is in a deplorable state, will be rehabilitated; and
(b)  when desks will be provided to the following basic schools:
(i)   Mulamatila; (ii)  Mulalila; (iii) Kalumwange; (iv) Longe;
(v)  Shishamba; (vi) Shimano; and (vii) Nkeyema.
(a)  when the maternity ward at Kwacha Clinic in Kwacha Parliamentary Constituency, whose construction was completed a long time ago, will become operational; and
(b)  when maternity wings will be constructed at the following health centres:
(i)  Mwaiseni; (ii)  Ipusukilo; (iii)  Riverside; and (iv) Bulangililo.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)  how many bicycles were donated to schools in Dundumwezi Parliamentary Constituency by the World Bicycle Relief Programme from 2009 to-date; and
(b)  which schools benefited from the donation.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works Supply and Communication when the Luapula valley road, especially the stretch between Mwense and Mununshi which is currently in a deplorable state, will be rehabilitated.
questions.question_text: NOTICE OF MOTION Mr Hamududu Report of the Committee on Estimates: That this House do adopt the Report of the Committee on Estimates, for the First Session of the Eleventh National Assembly, laid on the Table of the House on 21st June, 2012.
